intro: Hepetis oerstediana, commonly known as the Oersted's bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color and bloom in the spring. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture.
